DEPARTMENT OF
HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE
OFFICE OF EDUCATION
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
Dear Harry:
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director, NAEB
111 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
i
I wish I had been successful in reaching you by phone yester¬
day afternoon to give you my reactions to your "McLuhan project,"
for I am sure it would have been much easier that way. "What I say
on paper may not make sense, but here goes I
The over-all description of the project seems to me to be well
on its way. The title, however, needs to be strengthened, so as to
make it more easily identifiable as a means of improved teaching.
This same is true under "objectives," and there should be indication
somewhere along the line that the course materials eventually could be
included in programs of teacher training.
In trying to come up with a substitute title, I fell flat on
my face, except for an idea which goes like this: "Redefining the
Role of Media in Education." I did rry best to figure out a title
which could begin with "improved teaching," but inevitably it became
too long and involved. I am sure that brilliant mind of yours won't
have any trouble, provided you agree that my suggestion is worth the
bother.
After reviewing the proposal of research information, I couldn't
help feeling that if it is at all possible, you should duplicate those
pages from your original proposal which are pertinent, rather than
ask Norberg's office to refer back to them. I am fearful of the com¬
plications, if only one complete copy of your revision is submitted for
consideration by the Advisory Committee.
It was, as always, good to see you and I hope there will be
many other excuses to bring you this way.
Best wishes always.
Cordially yours.
(Mrs.) Gertrude G. Broderick
Radio-TV Education Specialist
